about.name: Milan
about.info_text: Milan, the capital of Italy's Lombardy region, is a global hub for fashion, design, finance, and culture. Known for its modern skyscrapers, historic architecture, and vibrant arts scene, Milan offers a blend of contemporary and classical elements. Visitors can explore iconic landmarks, such as the Milan Cathedral and Leonardo da Vinci's 'The Last Supper,' and indulge in world-class shopping and dining. With its cosmopolitan atmosphere, Milan is a dynamic and stylish destination for travelers from around the world.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 1,352,000
Region: Lombardy
Time Zone: Central European Time (UTC+01:00)
Language: Italian
Currency: Euro (EUR)
about.climate_text: Milan experiences a humid subtropical climate with hot, humid summers and cold, foggy winters. Spring and autumn are pleasant times to visit, with milder temperatures and fewer extremes.

attractions_card.title: Milan Cathedral
attractions_card.description: The Milan Cathedral (Duomo di Milano) is a magnificent Gothic cathedral known for its intricate facade and stunning interior. Visitors can climb to the rooftop for panoramic views of the city.

attractions_card.title: The Last Supper
attractions_card.description: Leonardo da Vinci's masterpiece, 'The Last Supper,' is located in the Convent of Santa Maria delle Grazie and is a significant work of art in Milan.

attractions_card.title: Galleria Vittorio Emanuele II
attractions_card.description: This historic shopping arcade, with its ornate architecture, houses high-end boutiques, cafes, and restaurants. It's a popular spot for shopping and people-watching.

attractions_card.title: Sforza Castle
attractions_card.description: The Sforza Castle is a grand fortress housing museums, art collections, and beautiful courtyards. It's a symbol of Milan's history and power.

attractions_card.title: Pinacoteca di Brera
attractions_card.description: This prestigious art gallery features an impressive collection of Italian paintings, including works by Caravaggio, Raphael, and Titian.

attractions_card.title: Navigli District
attractions_card.description: The Navigli district is known for its picturesque canals, lively bars, and vibrant nightlife. It's a great place for an evening stroll or aperitivo.

attractions_card.alt: Leonardo da Vinci National Museum of Science and Technology
attractions_card.title: Leonardo da Vinci National Museum of Science and Technology
attractions_card.description: This museum is dedicated to the life and work of Leonardo da Vinci, showcasing his inventions, models, and scientific contributions.

attractions_card.title: Teatro alla Scala
attractions_card.description: One of the world's most famous opera houses, Teatro alla Scala hosts renowned performances and is a cultural landmark in Milan.

food_card.title: Risotto alla Milanese
food_card.description: Risotto alla Milanese is a creamy saffron risotto, known for its rich and aromatic flavor. It's a classic Milanese dish.

food_card.title: Cotoletta alla Milanese
food_card.description: Cotoletta alla Milanese is a breaded and fried veal cutlet, often served with a wedge of lemon. It's a Milanese specialty.

food_card.title: Panettone
food_card.description: Panettone is a traditional Milanese Christmas cake, filled with candied fruits and raisins. It's a festive treat.

food_card.title: Milanese Pizza
food_card.description: Milanese pizza is known for its thin crust and creative toppings. Try a slice at one of the city's pizzerias.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Principe di Savoia
hotels_card.description: A luxurious hotel in the heart of Milan, offering elegant rooms, fine dining, and a rooftop spa with panoramic views.

hotels_card.title: Bulgari Hotel Milano
hotels_card.description: A sophisticated hotel in a former 18th-century palace, known for its elegant rooms, beautiful garden, and Michelin-starred restaurant.

hotels_card.title: Four Seasons Hotel Milan
hotels_card.description: This stylish hotel is located in a converted 15th-century convent, offering luxurious accommodations, a spa, and a tranquil courtyard.

hotels_card.title: Mandarin Oriental, Milan
hotels_card.description: A contemporary hotel with a chic design, it's well-regarded for its comfortable rooms, gourmet dining, and spa services.

transport_card.title: Metro
transport_card.description: Milan's metro system provides efficient transportation around the city, with multiple lines connecting key areas.

transport_card.title: Trams and Buses
transport_card.description: Trams and buses offer additional options for getting around Milan, providing access to various neighborhoods and Landmarks.

transport_card.title: Taxis
transport_card.description: Taxis are readily available in Milan and can be a convenient mode of transportation, especially for reaching specific destinations.

transport_card.title: Cycling
transport_card.description: Cycling is a popular way to explore Milan, with bike lanes and rental services available throughout the city.

transport_card.title: High-Speed Rail
transport_card.description: Milan is a major transportation hub with high-speed train connections to other Italian cities and international destinations, including Paris and Zurich.

transport_card.title: Milan Linate Airport
transport_card.description: Milan Linate Airport is one of the city's main airports, offering domestic and European flights for travelers.

transport_card.title: Milan Malpensa Airport
transport_card.description: Milan Malpensa Airport is another major airport serving the Milan metropolitan area, offering both domestic and international flights.
